result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:11 PM Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Marlo A Triggs Jr in court.  Attorney Heather Dvoran in court for Marlo A Triggs Jr. Counsel files waiver of preliminary hearing. Court examines defendant as to waiver, accepts waiver and binds matter over for trial. Counsel waives reading of the information and enters not guilty plea.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on October 12, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Clerk contacted defendant to reschedule 7/21 at 1:15 pm court date due to the Court's calendar conflict. Defendant has not retained counsel but will contact the Public Defender to determine if he is eligible for representation. Case rescheduled to 8/10 at 1:15 pm.

1:15 PM Marlo A Triggs Jr in court appeared by video, in custody from the Ozaukee County Jail. Atty Antonella Aleman-Zientek in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Heather Dvoran appearing as a friend of the court for Marlo A Triggs. Counsel waives reading of complaint and advises defendant wishes to retain private counsel. Court reviews charges/penalties thereof, right to counsel and finds probable cause. State requests $1,000 cash bail w/ conditions. Court finds good cause to extend time limits for defendant to hire counsel.
